intro: Salsola cryptoptera, commonly known as Russian thistle or goatweed, is a flowering plant in the family Amaranthaceae. It is an annual or biennial herb that typically grows in arid and semi-arid regions. The plant has a low, sprawling growth habit with spiny stems and small, greenish flowers. Its leaves are usually small, fleshy, and covered in a waxy coating to reduce water loss. Salsola cryptoptera is adapted to survive in harsh environments, making it a common weed in disturbed soils.
